title: what is this typeface?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080124104321im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_4596.jpg)

 [‹ Art Deco era?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080124104321/http:/typophile.com/node/41221 "Go to previous forum topic") [Help anyone!!? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080124104321/http:/typophile.com/node/41215 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jimmybloodygreat

comments.content:
\> what is this typeface?

... obviously invisible.

It looks like somebody messed around with Gill Italic.

Nick Cooke

This example helps to show why I think sans italic faces are the hardest things to ID. To me that ’a’ looks nothing like any form of Gill Sans, but so many sans faces have this sort of look. I think it’s [Bliss](http://web.archive.org/web/20080124104321/http:/www.typography.net/type/bliss.htm) myself.

- Mike Yanega
It’s really (and I mean REALLY) close to Bliss. But if it is, it’s modified (see the r and f).
I’ll third the Bliss with some modification (and maybe a little squooshing too).
